page.title: 09Sindles Farm
page.content: Only the portion of the farm to the south of Pits copse lies within the area under consideration. These two fields are permanent pasture and have been used for grazing since 1780. Pits copse was felled in 1984 and the timber was sold by tender. The trees were mature oak between 120 and 150 years old. A resident of westbourne has the contract for the underwood which he sells as firewood.(Underwood is timber which grows under main crop and used to be cut on a 20 year cycle, although this area had not been cut since the 2nd World War due to lack of demand.) The copse is due to be replanted with broadleaf timber in the near future.
